AIscreenR 0.0.0.9999
  • Reference

    Title and abstract screening with ChatGPT

    tabscreen_chatgpt.Rd

    This function supports the conduct of title and abstract screening with ChatGPT in R. The function allow to run title and abstract screening across multiple prompts and with repeated questions to check for consistency across answers.

    Usage

    tabscreen_chatgpt(
  data,
  prompt,
  studyid,
  title,
  abstract,
  api_key = get_api_key(),
  arrange_var = studyid,
  model = "gpt-3.5-turbo",
  sleep_time = 0,
  time_info = FALSE,
  reps = 1,
  seed = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    Insert

    prompt

    Insert

    studyid

    Insert

    title

    Insert

    abstract

    Insert

    api_key

    Numerical value with your personal API key. Find at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys

    arrange_var

    Function indicating the variables determing the arrangement of the data. Default is studyid.

    model

    Character indicating the ChatGPT model to be use. Default is "gpt-3.5-turbo".

    sleep_time

    Numerical value indicating in seconds the sleeping time in between questions. This is especially helpful when not a pay-as-you-go user. For more information see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/rate-limits/what-are-the-rate-limits-for-our-api

    time_info

    Logical indicating if the time of the answer should be returned.

    reps

    Numerical indicating the number of times the same question should be sent to ChatGPT. This can be useful to test consistency between answers. Default is 1.

    seed

    Numerical value for a seed to ensure that proper, parallel-safe random numbers are produced.

    ...

    Further time functions to be added to RETRY. See https://httr.r-lib.org/reference/RETRY.html

    Value

    A tibble with answer and run_time if time_info = TRUE.

    Examples

    
if (FALSE) {
library(future)

# Find your api key at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys
api_key <- 123456789

data <- load("data.RData")
prompts <- paste("Prompt", 1:3)

plan(multisession, workers = 7)

system.time(
 test_dat <-
  tabscreen_chatgpt(
    data = data,
    prompt = prompts,
    studyid = studyid,
    title = Title,
    abstract = Abstract
 )
)

}
